intro: Cynoctonum repandum, commonly known as the creeping cynoctonum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cynoglossaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces pale yellow to greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in warm climates as a decorative plant.
